gravity_system: Roof Trusses, Loadbearing Walls, Continuous Footings
key_elements: Retaining Walls, Moment Connections, Truss Bracing, Slat Floor for Tractor Support
overall_building_description: The structural design of the ELO Weber Farm Storage Shed integrates a robust framework to accommodate agricultural storage needs, emphasizing load path efficiency and material optimization. The foundation system employs continuous footings with 25 MPa concrete, reinforced with 15M rebar at strategic intervals, ensuring adequate bearing capacity and shear transfer. The retaining walls, detailed as FW2, FW3, and FW4, incorporate 3'-6" wide by 12" thick footings, reinforced with six 15M continuous rebars, and 15M bent dowels at 36" vertical and 24" horizontal spacing, providing lateral stability against soil pressures. The foundation plan specifies a 6" concrete floor with 32 MPa strength, supported by a compacted granular 'A' base, ensuring uniform load distribution and minimizing settlement. The main floor plan outlines a 6" concrete suspended slab, reinforced with a rebar grid, designed to support agricultural equipment and storage loads. The roof system features engineered trusses at 48" on center, with 29 gauge steel roofing, providing a lightweight yet durable covering. Truss bracing details include 2x4 struts and diagonal braces, anchored with 3 1/4" nails, ensuring lateral stability and diaphragm action. The moment frame connections utilize A325 bolts for high-strength connections, with precise bolt spacing to facilitate shear transfer and moment resistance. The structural platform detail highlights HSS beams and columns, with wedge bolts for anchorage, ensuring rigidity and load transfer efficiency. The site plan coordinates the new construction with existing facilities, maintaining clearances and property line adherence. The design adheres to relevant building codes, with uplift clips and venting provisions as per truss manufacturer specifications, ensuring compliance and performance under environmental loads. The assembly sequence prioritizes the erection of loadbearing elements, followed by truss installation and bracing, ensuring structural integrity throughout construction. Special conditions, such as access for hay drying equipment and tractor support, are addressed with reinforced slat floors and strategic beam placement, accommodating operational requirements. The use of hot-dip galvanized steel anchors and minimum 300W steel ensures durability and resistance to agricultural environments. The comprehensive detailing and material specifications reflect a commitment to structural resilience and functionality, tailored to the specific demands of agricultural storage.
